description: [Chinese Version] Updated 2024.05.22, optimized the display of important metrics. Rebuilt using the new Grafana 10 style, added the concept of health score, and added some charts for overall resource consumption information. Includes overall resource display and detailed resource charts: monitoring metrics such as CPU, memory, disk IO, and network. https://github.com/starsliao/TenSunS

panels.title: üè°Resource Overview: Current Job [$origin_prometheus: $job] Currently Selected Host [$show_name] Instance: $instance

panels.description:
Partition utilization, disk read, disk write, download bandwidth, and upload bandwidth. If there are multiple network cards or partitions, the data collected is the network card or partition with the highest utilization.

Connection count: CurrEstab - The number of TCP connections currently in ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT status.

Health value is a newly added metric, calculated based on CPU, memory, and I/O. A score below 90 indicates that system resource usage needs attention. This is a metric currently under testing, and the parameters may need further optimization based on actual conditions.
panels.title: Server Resource Overview [Total Number of Hosts: $total]

panels.description:
- P99: Data points in ascending order, representing the 99th percentile. (i.e., data points at the 99th percentile after ascending sort.)

- This table requires adding record rules in Prometheus (see the Kanban download page).

- Data will be displayed 1 hour after the record rules are added.

- Time range [7d:1h] indicates viewing data points for each hour within the past 7 days.
panels.title: P99 resource usage rate in the last 7 days
Overall total load and overall average CPU utilization
Total memory and average memory utilization
Total disk usage and average disk usage

panels.description:
In this dashboard, the values ‚Äã‚Äãfor total disk space, usage, availability, and utilization rate are consistent with the values ‚Äã‚Äãin the Size, Used, Avail, and Use% columns of the `df` command. Furthermore, the Use% value is rounded to one decimal place for greater accuracy.

Note: The Use% algorithm in `df` is: (size - free) * 100 / (avail + (size - free)). If the result is an integer, it is the given value; otherwise, it is the value plus 1. The unit of the result is %.

Refer to the `df` command source code:
panels.title: „Äê$show_name„Äë: Available space in the partition (EXT.*/XFS/NFS)

matcher.options: Processes blocked while waiting for I/O to complete

targets.legendFormat: Processes blocked while waiting for I/O to complete

panels.title: File descriptor (FD) / context switch per second

panels.description:
Read time (seconds): The number of seconds taken for a read operation on each disk partition.

Write time (seconds): The number of seconds taken for a write operation on each disk partition.

IO time (seconds): The number of seconds taken for an input/output operation on each disk partition.

IO time (weighted seconds): The number of seconds taken for a weighted input/output operation on each disk partition.
panels.title: Time taken for each I/O read/write operation (reference: less than 100ms)

panels.description:
Reads completed: Number of reads completed per second for each disk partition

Writes completed: Number of writes completed per second for each disk partition

IO now: Number of input/output requests being processed per second for each disk partition
panels.title: Disk read/write speed (IOPS)

panels.description:
Read bytes: Number of bits read per second per disk partition
Written bytes: Number of bits written per second per disk partition
panels.title: Disk read/write capacity per second

panels.description:
The time spent on I/O within each natural second. (wall-clock time)

node_disk_io_time_seconds_total: The number of seconds the disk spends on input/output operations. This value is accumulated. (Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os)

irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m]): Calculates the rate per second: (last value - previous value) / timestamp difference, i.e., the percentage of time the disk spends on I/O operations within 1 second.

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

panels.title: Percentage of I/O operation time per second (I/O Util)

panels.description:
Sockets_used - Total number of all protocol sockets used

CurrEstab - Number of TCP connections currently in ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT state

TCP_alloc - Number of allocated (established, acquired sk_buff) TCP sockets

TCP_tw - Number of TCP connections waiting to be closed

UDP_inuse - Number of UDP sockets currently in use

RetransSegs - Number of TCP retransmitted packets

OutSegs - Number of TCP packets sent

InSegs - Number of TCP packets received
panels.title: Network Socket Connection Information

title: Node Exporter Dashboard 20240520
